text: M. Rajendran (55) of Keezha Pandavaramangalam, a watchman of a water supply company, who suffered injuries after an explosive material burst on March 14, died in a hospital on Friday. The incident occurred while he was cleaning the premises. He was grievously injured on his legs in the blast and was admitted to Kovilpatti Government Headquarters Hospital and was shifted to Tirunelveli Government Medical College Hospital. Kovilpatti West police had registered a case under Sections 3, 4 and 5 of Explosive Substances Act, 1908, based on a complaint lodged by the injured watchman. However, this case was treated as murder under Section -302 of IPC following his death.
title: Explosion: watchman dies in hospital
